page.title: 02THE VILLAGE OF SALPERTON
page.content: Salperton,in the parish of Hazleton,is an isolated village in a shallow valley between the A436 Andoversford to Bourton road and the A40 Andoversford to Northleach road.It is in a wooded area and is surrounded by fields.There are 26 houses in the village.Nearly all are of Cotswold stone and several have been there for two to three hundred years.They stand on either side of the lane which winds through the village and of one other lane which tails off into a public footpath after going through a short tunnel under the old railway embankment.There are many attractive gardens with a small stream running through some of them.
